subject: RE: [junit] Re: Making good use of testing effort
msgSnippet: So what is the return type for the @DataPoints static method?  Is it a List of the data? That may be what the doctor ordered. From: junit@yahoogroups.com
messageBody:
So what is the return type for the @DataPoints static method? Is it a
List of the data?



That may be what the doctor ordered.



From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
David Saff
Sent: Monday, February 01, 2010 1:08 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Making good use of testing effort





Berin,

You can annotate a static method with @DataPoints, and do whatever
complex trickery you want inside the static method.

If you come up with great ways to dynamically, generically, generate
data points, and would like to contribute them, that would be
awesome--I was doing similar work with Agitar years ago, but most of
my approach relied on IP that went down with that ship.

David Saff
